text: Aciotis is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melastomataceae. There are about 13 species distributed from Mexico to Brazil.Freire-Fierro, A. (2002). Monograph of Aciotis (Melastomataceae). Systematic Botany Monographs, 1-99. Species include: * Aciotis acuminifolia (Mart. ex DC.) Triana * Aciotis annua (Mart. ex DC.) Triana * Aciotis aristellata Markgr. * Aciotis asplundii Wurdack * Aciotis circaeifolia (Bonpl.) Triana *Aciotis ferreirana * Aciotis indecora (Bonpl.) Triana * Aciotis oliveriana Freire-Fierro * Aciotis ornata (Miq.) Gleason * Aciotis paludosa (Mart. ex DC.) Triana * Aciotis polystachya (Bonpl.) Triana * Aciotis purpurascens (Aubl.) Triana * Aciotis rubricaulis (Mart. ex DC.) Triana * Aciotis viscida (Benth.) Freire-Fierro * Aciotis wurdackiana Freire-Fierro ==References== Category:Melastomataceae genera Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Aciotis
